trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with SimpleNexus | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with SimpleNexus | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use SimpleNexus with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use SimpleNexus with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SimpleNexus.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SimpleNexus.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A SimpleNexus single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A SimpleNexus single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SimpleNexus will be able to single sign into the application at your SimpleNexus company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SimpleNexus will be able to single sign into the application at your SimpleNexus company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for SimpleNexus
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for SimpleNexus

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SimpleNexus.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SimpleNexus.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type simple nexus.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type simple nexus.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select SimpleNexus, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select SimpleNexus, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Simple Nexus</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Simple Nexus</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SimpleNexus with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SimpleNexus with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the SimpleNexus application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the SimpleNexus application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to SimpleNexus page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to SimpleNexus page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the SimpleNexus Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://simplenexus.com/CompanyName\_login", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the SimpleNexus Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://simplenexus.com/CompanyName\_login", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at SimpleNexus page, click Download metadata, and then forward the metadata file to the SimpleNexus support team.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at SimpleNexus page, click Download metadata, and then forward the metadata file to the SimpleNexus support team.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on needs to be enabled by the SimpleNexus support team.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on needs to be enabled by the SimpleNexus support team.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SimpleNexus, they must be provisioned into SimpleNexus.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SimpleNexus, they must be provisioned into SimpleNexus.

trans-unit.source: In the case of SimpleNexus, provisioning is a manual task performed by the tenant administrator.
trans-unit.target: In the case of SimpleNexus, provisioning is a manual task performed by the tenant administrator.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other SimpleNexus user account creation tools or APIs provided by SimpleNexus to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other SimpleNexus user account creation tools or APIs provided by SimpleNexus to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the SimpleNexus **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the SimpleNexus **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
